A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In the wake of the Landstraad, the great earthquake that has the Yeomanry in shambles, the giants of the Jotens and their humanoid armies are taking advantage of the chaos to march on the Yeomanry's capital city of Loftwick! The Yeoman Army sallies forth to meet them, but a ragged dwarf stumbles into town, warning of a more insidious threat.

An Aftershock adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210839.name: The Hole Truth
210839.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A quiet night in Tarris heats up quickly. Can the characters discover the perpetrators of a dastardly crime and catch them before it's too late?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210840.name: Guard Dogs
210840.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Groups of refugees from the Hold of the Sea Princes are disappearing amidst the Tors. The authorities seem to care little about the deaths of helpless foreigners. Can you be a good shepherd and escort your flock to safety? Or will the unseen wolves claim you as well as your charges?

An adventure for [character levels] 4 - 8.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210841.name: In Darkness, Despair
210841.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A Yeoman March goes missing after investigating a newly uncovered mineshaft thought to belong to a long forgotten dwarven city that plunged into the earth centuries ago. What could be the reason for their disappearance? Stalwart Yeoman adventurers are asked to answer the call.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 10.

210842.name: Sticks and Stones
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210842.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Della, the ‘Rogue Queen of Monmurg,’ has disappeared, and Yeoman officials fear she has broken her contract and fled back to the Hold of the Sea Princes. Can you stop her before she discloses valuable information to the Scarlet Brotherhood enemies to the south?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 10 and Part Two in the Cold as Stone Saga.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210843.name: Crimson Skies
210843.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

As summer’s end draws nigh, you find yourself in the town of Spitalvale, and it seems as though you are in luck. The town is preparing for the Temple of Phaulkon’s annual celebration of First Flight.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210844.name: The Rhythm of Drums
210844.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The sound of drums is never uncommon this close to the Hellfurnaces, but a recent border patrol brings ominous news. Can the PCs silence the drums before they themselves are silenced?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 10.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210845.name: Squeal Like a Pig
210845.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A peaceful romp in Bogspur turns into a nightmare filled with bayou halflings, Midfell mountain oysters and... orc brides? Come to think of it, what the heck are you doing in Bogspur again in the first place? Bring your funnybones.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210846.name: Masking the Truth
210846.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Evidence has been uncovered of an ancient tomb in the outer reaches of the Hool Marshes. A Yeoman Dustdigger has asked you to assist her in entering the swamp, discovering the tomb, and bringing back a magical mask.

An Introductory Yeomanry module for first-level characters.

Cannot be played by players who have already played the Year One Yeomanry regional of the same name.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210847.name: Flesh and Spirit
210847.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Tragedy strikes the town of Tucksvale: a youth is cut down in his prime. What could have done such a terrible thing? Can it be stopped before anyone else loses their life?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210848.name: Petals
210848.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

"She loves me, she loves me not..." Petals fall from the fingers of a blind priest as he contemplates love lost. Things get ugly as adventurers travel through a world of beauty.

A Yeomanry Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 10.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210849.name: Dust to Dust
210849.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A call for assistance from the Watchers of the Stone brings you to the peculiar town of Kelzad. Why is it so important to these blind albinos that you explore a recently discovered archeological site? Will your deeds bring renewed hope to the Yeomanry or loose an ancient terror on the land?

A Yeomanry Regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210850.name: Season of the Wolf
210850.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The woods are darker now and more dangerous. The residents of Shalehal lock their doors and shutter their windows now when night falls and the mists creep in. Everyone stokes the fire a little higher when the wolves howl from the Shale Fens. Not marked on any calendar, the Season of the Wolf is upon us.

A Yeomanry Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12; and Part One of the Ties That Bind series.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210851.name: Whispers of Deceit
210851.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In the quiet town of Eastcot something strange is happening. A visiting noble has gone missing and the family is up in arms. Can you discover what has happened before the situation becomes a serious international incident?

An investigative Yeomanry Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210852.name: By Brick and Mortar
210852.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A rediscovered tome hints at the final resting place of the infamous Archlich Asberdies, tyrant of the Yeoman people. Now that journal has been stolen out of the grasp of the Council of High Magic. You have been summoned in utmost secrecy to the University of Loftwick.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210853.name: The Heart of Betrayal
210853.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Sometimes the wind from one door closing opens another. Even from afar, those with ears to hear and eyes to see can sense the change. Yet vision and hearing can only go so far. The Watchers of the Stone need someone to serve as their “eyes”. Do you dare to be a light in the darkness or will you be swallowed up by the shadows?

A two-round Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

210854.name: Thicket's Dirge
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210854.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk [Introductory] Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In the aftermath of the disastrous earthquake called the Landstraad, travel and trade has been disrupted all across the Yeomanry League. The Escarpment has nearly doubled in size, and changed the land along its length. Now, you have been asked to escort a small caravan around the northern reaches of the Escarpment along the fringes of the Iron Wood.

An introductory Yeomanry regional adventure for first level
characters, and Part 1 of the Aftershocks Series.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210855.name: Attack Dogs
210855.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Politics makes strange bedfellows. Perhaps that can explain why long-time enemies have joined forces and called upon you for help. Some of you are called out of respect for good deeds done. Others are called to atone for past betrayals. All will risk their lives to sink their teeth into the Scarlet Brotherhood’s throat. Cry havoc and let slip the dogs of war.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210856.name: Shield of Fury, Shield of Faith
210856.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A chance encounter while exploring the Little Hills leads the adventurers in search of a legendary Yeoman League artifact. Can this have anything to do with the lost bolthole of the magelord Asberdies you were originally looking for?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

210857.name: Break My Bones
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210857.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Chaos reigns in the Yeomanry! Freeholder Marius Lindon is missing, and controversial Grosspokeswoman Melinda Windomere is taking responsibility to find out what happened. And what, if anything, does the medusa rogue Della know about it?

A Yeomanry regional whodunit adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12, and Part Three of the Cold as Stone series.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210858.name: Prophecies of Ash
210858.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Another call for assistance from the Watchers of the Stone brings you back to the peculiar town of Kelzad. They ask that you journey into the Underoerth and retrieve an ancient weapon. Will your deeds bring renewed hope to the Yeomanry or will you lose yourselves in the endless night beneath the surface of Oerth?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and Part Two of the Return of the Deliverer series.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210859.name: Into the Scarlet Flames
210859.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A man’s associate has gone missing in a dangerous land. He is unable to go to the rescue, but he is willing to pay to have some stouthearted Yeomen rescue his companion.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for character levels 2 - 8.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210860.name: Broken Spear
210860.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The tranquility amongst the vineyards of Coldfair Green is interrupted by the kidnapping of a boy, the son of a wealthy landowner. The party must keep their wits about them and act quickly to foil the sinister plot set forth by the child's abductors.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210861.name: Blighted Souls
210861.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Storm clouds gather over the Yeomanry. Seers, oracles and soothsayers are struck dumb, or can only speak of the end of the land. In the darkest hours of the night, dreams turn into nightmares. Amid rumor and speculation, the adventurers gather against the dangers of oncoming night at the base of the towering Escarpment. Shouts call out as a lone figure approaches out of the night.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 16, and part of the Asberdies storyline.

210862.name: Here Comes the Bride
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210862.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk [Introductory] Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Looking for work? Travel... see the Yeomanry. Simply walk a woman from one town to another and get paid for it. No experience required.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for first level characters, and Part 1 of the Brides Series.

210863.name: The Valley of Kyros
210863.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Valley of Kyros is a campaign setting which can be introduced to various locations of the Sword Coast.

It contains


A map of the valley, Mud Creek which is it's main village and the Ruins of Kyros.



Four major NPC's with background and stats.



A summary of the valley, it's inhabitants and main areas of interest.

210867.description: This 140×70 cm playmat was available as an add-on in the Kickstarter campaign. They made two versions, one by ASYNCRON for the European backers, the other by Academy Games for the rest of the world (although the French Canadian backers got theirs from the European allotment). The mats were made by www.wogamat.com (www.plateauxdejeux.com).
210867.name: Mare Nostrum: Empires – Giant Map

210869.name: Clement Sector: The Rules
210869.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your adventure starts here!

Join the adventure as Clement Sector, one of the most popular and fastest growing science fiction settings, expands with its own rulebook! Using a unique blend of The Cepheus Engine and the 2d6 Science Fiction OGL rules, Clement Sector: The Rules builds on those to create a framework for action packed role-playing game excitement!

Fight epic space battles! Explore new worlds! Become a pirate! It's all possible in Clement Sector and these rules provide the foundation for your exploits!

Use these rules for your own settings or, in concert with The Clement Sector Core Setting Book, strike out on an adventure in the Clement Sector setting. It's in your control!

210870.name: Drider Corruption
210870.description:
From publisher blurb:

Along Came A Spider...

Corruptions, from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Horror Adventures, give players a new way to indulge their dark fantasies and take the role of gothic monsters, infecting themselves with some taint or darkness, and presenting the tantalizing question of whether to struggle against the corruption, or embrace it, and allow themselves to bask, however briefly, in its dark power. While Horror Adventures presents 11 different corruptions to choose from, there are many more potential sources of corruption that could potentially be explored.

This book presents the drider corruption, a brand new corruption featuring unique progression rules, and 10 new manifestations that are flavorfully connected to driders, as well as other spider-like monsters. Further, the book introduces the greater drider, a new CR 14 Huge drider with venomous webs, drinks the blood of its victims, and can inflict the drider corruption on those that it catches in its webs.

210871.name: Griffins: A Field Guide
210871.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never leave the tavern without a good guide.

Want a griffin mount? A griffin companion for your Ranger? How about a griffin familiar? We've got you covered.

Griffins — A Field Guide is a richly illustrated and comprehensive set of field notes dealing with griffins and griffin ecology. The book includes 6 griffin species, 2 archetypes and the Order of the Gryphon cavalier order.

Inside this beautiful book you'll find...

Grypites rex, a powerful CR 8 griffin, the choice of champions and kings.
A terrifying CR 10 griffin, the spawn of foul magics.
Mandover's feral griffin, a pest to adventurers.
The common griffin, a new take on an old favorite.
Griffin rider archetypes for the Ranger and Cavalier classes.
The sorcerer's griffin, the perfect familiar for your wizard.
And much more...

210872.name: Claustrophobia! (Revised)
210872.description:
From publisher blurb:

Insanity Below

In the deep darkness below the earth, there is only Claustrophobia!

Grab your pointy hat and say goodbye to the daisies, it’s time to embark on a perilous subterranean journey as a brave — or suicidal — garden gnome.

I Pinky Swear I'll be a Good AI

Face grueling challenges and unique monsters as you explore the dark places, travelling aboard the HMS Keeton, a scratch built, nuclear powered drilling rig with a mind of its own.

Super Awesome Tiger Punch

Claustrophobia's unique mechanics and elegant rules system emphasizes cooperative story play, providing the perfect mix for an evening's hilarious insanity. Just add friends and dice.

Will you dare the darkness?

210873.name: Alone, But Not Afraid
210873.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stuart Lloyd provides suggestions to have the most fun while playing solo adventures using the Deluxe Tunnels and Trolls rules.

210874.name: Attack on the Andall Mines
210874.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today’s offering continues in the Theocracy of Wagovia. TW3 - Attack on the Andall Mines. As your experience is beginning to get noticed a new problem has come to Lakedale. Reports of the profitable Andall Mine to the south is under attack by humanoids. Gather your cohorts…looks like it is time to go back to work and see if you can boost your fame!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Wagovian Campaign, but is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

210875.description:
The DC Dice Masters: World Finest Collector’s Box is a great space to store your Dice Masters collection! It has a limited edition Full Art promo card and everything one player needs to get started! Improve and complete your team to crush the competition by collecting more cards and dice in foil packs and other sets!

Each DC Dice Masters: World Finest Collector’s Box contains:

20 custom dice
1 felt dice bag
10 Basic Action Cards
4 Indicator Cards
1 Full Art Promo Card
4 DC Dice Masters: World Finest Foil Packs
2 dice storage trays that hold over 300 dice
210875.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: World Finest Collector's Box

210876.description:
The Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War - Collector's Box has eyerthing 1 Player needs to get started playing Dice Masters!

Each Collector's Box contains: 20 custom dice, 1 felt dice bag, 10 Basic Action Cards, 4 Indicator Cards, 1 Full Art Promo Card, 4 Marvel Dice Masters: The Civil War Foil Packs and 2 dice storage trays that hold over 300 dice.
210876.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War – Collector's Box

210877.name: 30 Fey Feats
210877.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wield the powers of the elder fey! Inside this edition of Feats of Legend is 30 new fey-themed feats. These feats are designed for use with any character looking to use the powers of the seelie courts, be them fey-blooded sorcerers, half-fey, elves or wild adventurers.

210878.name: Silver Linings
210878.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 11 party!

It's the storm no one will be able to forget... that is, of course, if there's anyone left around to remember it. Days after fighting off an incursion by a legion of hobgoblins, a great storm fell upon the kingdom. Rain pours relentlessly, thunder pounds across the air, and lightning ravages the landscape. Days have passed and the storm shows no sign of letting up!

Any relief felt from defeating the hobgoblin invaders has been scoured away; the thunderstorm grows larger, more violent, and more dangerous with each day. There are not many silver linings to be found, although there is a group of capable heroes in town looking for an adventure. Only the PCs are strong enough to investigate the storm's origin and bring an end to it to save the kingdom. But if they don't act soon, there may not be anything left of the kingdom to save!

210879.name: Out for Blood
210879.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 15 party!

It’s a night of celebration! The eccentric and flamboyant Lord Warren Halethorpe has invited the party members, among other honored guests, to delight in an evening of music, food, wine, and merriment. The lord has made a habit of throwing grandiose parties, and this night’s affair promises to be his finest yet: a masquerade gala for only the most esteemed citizens in the land! Masks, of course, will be provided to those who cannot bring their own.

But it isn’t all masks and mirth taking stage at the masquerade; the gala serves as a front for long-waited revenge. The party must discover the evil creature out for blood against the attendees, and stop it in the lord’s castle before it spreads its reach across the land!

210880.name: Time & Time Again
210880.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 19 party!

When the forces of chaos threaten to unleash a primordial titan upon the world, the party must scramble to undo their awful work. This creature has been prophesied to rise from the Great Well of New Moon’s Rise, a nature temple which overlooks the ocean. However, the problem isn’t finding where to stop the forces of chaos, but when. The chaos infesting the temple has caused time itself to become quite unstable; now past, present, and future collide as part of chaos’ plan!

Fortunately, if anyone can stop the titan from emerging from the temple, it’s the party. They’ve proven they can overcome the odds, time and time again throughout their illustrious careers. New Moon’s Rise may be their biggest challenge yet, but there awaits familiar allies who really push the meaning of "self-dependence."

210882.name: Of Crown & Kingdom
210882.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dynamic rulers... and the lands they rule!

This supplement contains information on 6 fantasy kingdoms you can customize to add to your game world. Each kingdom contains details of its ruler, the culture of its people, places of interest within its borders, and the relationships it harbors with outsiders. Each is designed to inspire you... what adventure lurks within these kingdoms? What stories can tell about their rulers?

210883.name: Dungeon Delves
210883.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intriguing adventure sites - ready for you to fill!

Here you'll find 6 adventure sites for you to use in your 5th edition campaign. Each site is accompanied by a series of questions and tips you can use to build an adventure around it. A stand alone map, without grids or secrets, is also provided for your use with each location. What creatures lurk here in each place to challenge an adventuring party? What treasures could the party party?

You decide!

210884.name: Chasing the Green
210884.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chasing the Green is a 2 - 3 hour adventure for three to four 1st level characters, but can easily be adjusted for 2nd level characters by adding to the encounters.

This adventure is the second of the Mud Creek trilogy. A set of adventures for low level characters which takes them from 1st level to 3rd level and sets them on a path to glory or infamy. In this adventure the players meet for the first time a potential patron or archvillain.

210885.name: The Quarrelsome Quarry
210885.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Quarrelsome Quarry is a 2-3 hour adventure for 2nd level characters at the end of which the players need to make a choice that will decide their path.

This adventure is the third and final adventure of the Mud Creek trilogy. A set of adventures for low level characters which takes them from 1st level to 3rd level and sets them on a path to glory or infamy.

210886.name: The Purging Flames
210886.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The third and final adventure in the Valley of Kyros trilogy. Here our heroes finally attempt to destroy to Orb of Saarith.

This low level adventure is designed for 3-4 players of fourth level.

210887.name: A Source of Secrets
210887.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this adventure our heroes set out to discover the secrets of Saarith. A lich they unwittingly released from a magical prison.

This adventure is designed to be a low level adventure for three to four 2nd to 3rd level characters that lean towards good alignment.

210888.name: Lights of Darkness
210888.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this adventure our heroes learn the purpose of the orb and continue to oppose Saariths plans.

This adventure is designed to be a low level adventure for three to four 3rd to 4th level characters that lean towards good alignments.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210890.name: Night, Knight
210890.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A Freeknight has been assassinated and the culprit is at large. The Yeomanry government seeks aid in apprehending the suspect. Adventurers are needed to face the trail of dread the assassin has left behind.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210891.name: Seeking Scarlet Glory
210891.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The apprentice of your good friend, Wizard Kevis, has discovered a possible location of ancient treasures in an old manuscript dating back to the time of the Great Suel Migration. Do you have the skill and courage to seek the storehouse?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8, and a loose follow up to YEO5-05: Into the Scarlet Flames.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210892.name: Of My Enemy
210892.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Politics may make strange bedfellows indeed. Even in so traditional a place as the Yeomanry, strange things may happen, for "An enemy of my enemy..."

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 12; and the resolution of prisoners of war taken in YEO5-06: Broken Spear.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to non-Elf, role-playing, fighter-heavy parties willing to serve the best interests of the Yeomanry. Elves are discouraged from playing this module. Paladins may be uncomfortable with the issues raised in this module.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210893.name: Blood Shadows
210893.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The town of Singleton in the northeastern corner of the Yeomanry has always been a bone of contention between the League and the Kingdom of Keoland. Control of the town has shifted back and forth across the years. The Yeomanry has the strongest claim currently, with their control for the past several hundred years. Whispers of renewed interest in the town from Keoland have sent you east to Singleton to gauge the lay of the land.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and Part 1 of the Iron River series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to military PCs and all loyal Yeomen.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210894.name: The Menagerie
210894.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The lure of possible wonders drew a Dustdigger expedition to seek the rumored underground Menagerie of an ancient mage. No one has heard from them since the Landstraad four years ago. Now adventurers are needed to discover the lost expedition’s fate and retrieve what it found - if there’s a ghost of a chance! However, dead men tell no tales; or do they?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the Academy of Lore.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210895.name: Howl at the Moon
210895.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Something is wrong in the small hamlet of Woodsend - the people stay indoors and the crops go untended while carcasses of livestock lay here and there showing signs of scavengers about. Can the characters face the menace that threatens this town, or will they, too, fall to these fell creatures?

A Yeomanry regional tale of horror in 5 acts for [character levels] 2 - 8, and Part 1 of the Sins of Our Fathers series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to fighter-heavy and outdoor-skilled parties. It is not intended for play by any character above 9th level, as these characters will significantly reduce the challenge the party faces. It is playable by characters up to 11th level as per standard rules, however.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210896.name: A Curious Diversion
210896.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You have heard that the mines in the mountains are having problems with bandits, but what is that woman doing lying in the road?

A one-round Yeomanry adventure for [character levels] 2 to 6.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members and students of the Academy of Lore.

210897.name: Another Bride... Another Groom?
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210897.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A wedding, an investigation, and a mysterious groom…what else do you need to know?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 6 and Part 2 of the Brides series.

Note: Having already played YEO5-IS1: Here Comes the Bride is recommended but not required. However, you may not play YEO5-IS1: Here Comes the Bride after playing this adventure.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210898.name: Dusty Tomes
210898.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Reference materials have been stolen from the University at Loftwick. Can you help recover them without loosing your head? If the clash of steel on steel is your only love, you might choose another locale.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 6.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the University at Loftwick and the military.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210899.name: Guards for Hire
210899.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk [Introductory] Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Need a Job? The Merchant’s Guild of Loftwick needs adventurers to serve as caravan guards to accompany caravans and merchants traveling the heart of the Yeomanry. Travel between the major towns of the Yeomanry and earn gold. Adventurers must posses their own equipment, but horses and rations will be supplied by your employer.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [1st level characters].

210900.description:
In Topiary, players are trying to position their meeples on the outer edge of a beautiful topiary garden in order to give them the best view possible. Meeples can see the closest topiary sculpture to them and any behind them in a row or column with a higher number. You can score Bonus points by seeing multiple sculptures of the same type. Players slowly fill in the garden by adding cards to the garden until everyone has placed their meeples.

Topiary is for 2-4 players and it plays in about 20 minutes.
210900.name: Topiary

210901.name: The Eyez
210901.description: You play simultaneously, trying to capture as many correct pairs of Eyez as possible. To collect pairs you have to pick up one Eye at the time and look under it. After that you either lay it back on the same spot or you lay it on top of another Eye to form a Pair. Now you place the pair of Eyez in front of you. Every correct pair scores you 2 points, every incorrect pair costs you 1 point. And for every correct identical pair you score 1 bonus point.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210902.name: Skin Deep
210902.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Students from the University at Loftwick are disappearing without a trace. The city watch is mystified. The students are terrified. The president, in desperation, calls on a group of adventurers to get to the bottom of the mystery before another tragedy occurs. An investigative Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 6.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the University at Loftwick and military characters.

210903.name: Castles & Crusades Slipcase
210903.description:
The Castles & Crusades Slipcase comes complete with the C&C Players Handbook, C&C Monsters & Treasure and the C&C Castle Keepers Guide.

The slip holds all three books snuggly, but we know you use your books all the time! So the slipcase comes thumbnotched on either side for easy access and there's an additional space at the top of the books to allow even easier access.

The case is made of 80 pt. graphic board, is heavy, durable.

Source: Publisher Blurb

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210904.name: Honor Among Friends
210904.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Men and women of the Yeomanry are known for always answering the call of duty. What happens when one’s personal honor to one’s fellow man is threatened before the completion of that duty? Can you help someone satisfy his personal honor and complete his Yeomanry duty? Or must one be sacrificed for the other?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to anyone with aspirations of joining or membership in the Brotherhood of Duelists, members of the military, and Rascals.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210906.name: A Betrayal Most Foul
210906.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The city of Loftwick goes on its day-to-day workings. Markets thrive, citizens hustle about, and children play; however, in the Tower of High Sorcery, things are missing. A master has been betrayed and the call has gone out to loyal Yeoman and any others who fight on the side of justice. Heroes should be prepared to root out an ungrateful thief and return what is not rightfully his.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Members of the University at Loftwick.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210907.name: Dark Gate Stalkers
210907.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

"Brave Heroes: Our town of Dark Gate is being terrorized by forces unknown. Someone or something is kidnapping residents who step outdoors after dark. Some say the ghostly Lerara Suel are to blame, ranging out at night from Slerotin’s Passage. The Border Guard here in Dark Gate are brave, but are stymied by these attacks. If you can help us, please hurry to Dark Gate."

- Spokesman Olmir.




A two-round Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

210908.name: It's a Train Wreck!
210908.description:
What do you call a 10 minute, real time, cooperative, dexterity, pick up and deliver, asymmetrical player setup, party game?
Answer: "It’s a Train Wreck!"

Two to six players work together to deliver as many goods as possible before the end of 10 minutes. Each type of cargo is represented by dice of a particular color. Example: Yellow = Corn. During setup and before the clock is started the cargo dice are rolled and the number of pips indicates the destination city. Once the clock is started all players take their actions simultaneously, in any order, and repeating any action as often as necessary. To transport the cargo, the dice must first be loaded onto a short or long train piece that is at rest in the player’s home city train yard. No train can move without a red caboose die, and no caboose can travel beyond the adjacent player’s city. In order to transport cargo to more distant cities a train will need to first stop and have the caboose dice swapped or cargo exchanged between trains. While all this is going on players must avoid dropping or spilling cargo or caboose dice when picking up or handing the train to another player. Tunnels and bridges between some cities present additional obstacles to negotiate. When time runs out calculate the score and compare the results to the achievement chart. Positive points are awarded for goods delivered to the correct city and trains that are able to stop in a train yard. Points are subtracted for dropped cargo, dropped cabooses, or cargo delivered to the wrong city. Players should try again to beat their best score and time. Optionally multiple teams can use additional copies of the game to compete head to head.

With six players each takes one of the six main cities, each producing a single type of goods which are delivered to the other five locations.
City #1 - Los Angeles – produces and ships Perishable Goods – Orange dice
City #2 – Denver – produces and ships Minerals – Grey dice
City #3 – St. Louis – produces and ships Corn – Yellow dice
City #4 – Chicago – produces and ships Meat – Pink dice
City #5 – Pittsburg – produces and ships Steel – Blue dice
City #6 – New York – produces and ships Manufactured Goods – Purple dice
Note in some scenarios with fewer total players, each player may actually control multiple cities.

The components that make up one player’s city are as follows:
One City Name marker
One associated city number-tent (#1, #2, #3, #4, #5 or #6)
One “Goods Production Source” card. Example: Illustration of a corn field for the production of corn.
Five “Goods Received” cards (to hold goods arrived from other cities).
One train yard (spaces for two trains, only one of which will fit the long train)
One short train (unloaded) (the TTR-1aB)
One large train (unloaded) (the BFT-9000)
Three customized Red dice (each represents a caboose, one for both starting trains and one spare). All three caboose dice start on the train yard in the designated caboose track. The number on the caboose matters and should match the home city.
One set of cargo dice (all of a single color)


Cattle and Timber and Beer, Oh My! Expansions (sold separately)
For additional challenge, smaller satellite cities can be added to the game. They come with a smaller train yard but no trains of their own. Any given satellite city may be controlled along with a player’s main city. Example: The player controlling New York can also control Boston, which produces Fish. Additional cargo dice types:

Brown = Cattle
Green = Timber/Wood Products
Shimmering Black = Oil
Silver and Blue Swirled = Fish
Metal Flake Black = Automobiles
Ivory = Wheat
Translucent Amber = Beer
White = Cotton
Black = Coal

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210909.name: A Widow's Tears
210909.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What solace can any adventurer give an aging crone, alone in the woods, her missing husband unreturned for a fortnight now? What solace indeed can slack the flow of a widow’s tears?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 10, and Part Two (and the Conclusion) of the Sins of Our Fathers series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to outdoorsy types and members of the military.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210910.name: Opposing Forces
210910.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A wealthy merchant in the city of Loftwick has issued a call for adventurers; riches, fame, and glory have been promised. What a scavenger hunt! Recommended for multi-talented parties of adventurers.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 14.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210911.name: Wanted: Citizen - Dead or Alive
210911.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A young militiaman has gone missing and is feared captured or killed by forces bent on destruction. The hero’s family is in dire need of his rescue. Do you have the courage and strength to make the attempt?

A one-round Yeomanry regional adventure for [character level] 6 to 14.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to [player characters] belonging to the Yeomanry Military and Citizen [player characters].

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210912.name: Finders, Keepers
210912.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It’s been several years since the disappearance of Freeholder Marius Lindon and the rise of Acting Freeholder Melinda Windomere. Other than a statue found in the waters of the Javan near Longspear, there has been no trace of the missing Freeholder. But help comes from mysterious places and only by trusting the unknown can the Freeholder be rescued.

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4-12, and Part One of the End of the World As We Know It series.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210913.name: There Will Be Blood
210913.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The hamlet of Bogspur has been overrun by the denizens of the Hool swamp. The bullywugs are on the march! Strike teams are forming and will be sent on exceedingly dangerous combat missions where members of the regular army are very likely to fail. Only expert adventurers of all levels need to apply.

A Yeomanry interactive adventure for [character levels] 2 - 14.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the Yeoman military.

User summary:

This is a regional "interactive" (semi-LARP) scenario.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
210914.name: The Yeomanry
210914.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the grand and beautiful home of a strong and free people! Your character has the fortune to adventure in the Yeomanry, a bastion of freedom and democracy rare on Oerth. Rich in culture, history, and adventure, the Yeomanry provides ample opportunity for young and energetic adventurers to find their fortunes and become the stuff of legend! Unlike its neighbors to the north and south, the Yeomanry held against both giant and humanoid invasions and Scarlet Brotherhood infiltration, and its people possess a fierce pride that is visible in every aspect of their lives.

User summary:

This document served as a concise introduction to the Yeomanry for players involved in Living Greyhawk convention/tournament play. It includes character design restrictions.

210915.description:
A promo card with alternate art originally available at Spiel 2016 at White Wizard Games Booth.

Convoy Bot

Faction: Machine Cult
Cost: 3
Primary Ability: Combat (4) You may scrap a card in your hand or discard pile
Ally Ability: (Machine Cult) Combat (2)
210915.name: Star Realms: Convoy Bot Promo Card

210917.name: Meditations of the Imperial Mystics (5E)
210917.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four amazing tomes of feats, spells, and new 5E class options for dealing with ki, ideal not just for monks but spellcasters too!

Meditations of the Imperial Mystics brings together the sublime secrets of joining mind, body, and spirit with the study of magic as recorded by the revered masters and their fanatical acolytes in ages gone past. Though fragments of their unattainable wisdom have survived in bits and pieces, the true original sources are accounted as great treasures among those who hold them. Rarely have their mysteries been unfolded, but gathered together they wait for you.

Body Outside Body, a teak-covered tome whose inscrutable diagrams unfold the mysteries of ki auras and their connections to knowledge, wisdom, fate, and the mind.
The Instructions of Yin-Blood and Thundering Yang, a unique inverting scroll that read forwards explicates the malleability of cool, yielding yin while read in reverse exposes the eruptive possibilities of fulminant yang, and the proper channeling of each power.
Prayers of Empty Flesh & Undying Ki, recorded on an infinitely unspooling prayer wheel that draws the mind and soul more deeply the more its chant is intoned, unveils the secrets of straddling the borders of life and death, of making transcendent spirit master base flesh.
Seven-Ghost-Needles, an academic and clinical treatise on the inner flows of ki through the body and mind and how to focus and channel it through the dantian centers of jin, shen, and wuji.




Inside this 22-page product you will find 18 ki-related feats, from Mindworm and Recenter Flow to Dream Travel and Aura Absolution, as well as 6 new spells, from paradox to steal dying breath. In addition, these tomes contain unique ki training and ability enhancement rules through the study of esoteric texts of the ancient masters, broadening the powers of qinggong while exploring the deeper connections of ki, magic, and mysticism, including supernatural acupuncture, internalization of extreme yin and yang, linkage of mind, spirit, and fate through spirit-auras, and the mortification of the flesh to span the threshold of life and death. This product is compatible with and expands upon the ki rules introduced in The Way of Ki (5E) but does not require that product for use.

210918.name: Tick Tock Isle
210918.description:
In the year 20XX a confident, young horologist by the name of Strike is inadvertently transported into the past while attempting to repair a mysterious, abandoned clock tower. Endeavoring to return to the future, Strike must fix both the time machine and the island’s dysfunctional family who are responsible for much of the clock’s disrepair.

Tick Tock Isle plays like a puzzle platform game that relies heavily on story, character interaction, creative thinking, and poking.‬

Source: The Developer Website.

210919.name: Inquisitor Spells V (3PP)
210919.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level inquisitor spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

210920.name: Inquisitor Spells V (PRD)
210920.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level inquisitor spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

210921.name: Witch Spells VII (PRD)
210921.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level witch spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

210922.name: Witch Spells VII (3PP)
210922.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level witch spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210923.name: Noble Ambitions
210923.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

The Lady Ashbury is in search for individuals of stout heart and strong sword arm to serve in a task requiring courage, resourcefulness and honor. This is event one of the Nobles Series.

An adventure for characters level 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210924.name: Giants on the Move
210924.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

A party of PCs is approached for a scouting mission. A raiding band of Hill Giants has ravaged a remote Gnome village in the Kron Hills, leaving three dead and one missing Gnome Scout. With five days to accomplish the mission, the party must also remain undetected.

Event one of the Giant Series. An adventure for characters level 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210925.name: Gift of Beauty
210925.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

His Lordship Viscount Langard has sponsored a contest throughout the Viscounty to find a gift for Her Fey Majesty of Celene. How will it look if this Royal Gesture is interrupted by a group of bandits? Event 1 of the Viscount Series.

An adventure for characters levels 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210926.name: How Greenway Was My Valley
210926.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Gnome raiders are striking against the southern holding of Lord Galans. He is in need of a group of adventurers to stop the raids and restores order to his lands.

An adventure for characters leve 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210927.name: Games Afoot: A Big Foot
210927.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The punitive raiding force of gnomes, sent out to punish the Hill giants for last month’s raid, has never returned. Glennddarc fears the worst. He desperately needs to know what happened.

Event 2 of the giant Series.

An adventure for characters levels 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210928.name: Forest of Mysteries
210928.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Gnarley Rangers are concerned over a missing alley. Occupied in deeper troubles from Pomarj, they seek friends of the forest to assist in the finding of this prince of his kind.

This is event one of the Gnarley Forest.

An adventure for characters level 3-8.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210929.name: Knocking on the Keep
210929.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A dwarven friend and smith is in need of a favor. Will the heroes of Ashbury Manor answer the call for aid?

This is event one of the Dwarven series.

An adventure for characters level 1-6.

210930.name: Abbey of Intrigue
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210930.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An ancient battle between brothers and goblinoid raids in Larneystoe. Unravel the mystery and save the Abbot from demise.

This is the first event in the Religious series.

An adventure for character levels 1-6.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210931.name: Knights and Days
210931.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A Knight of the Faithful Defender is marked of treason. Broken Oaths of Honor and Deceit of Treason are portals to Evil. Is the Knight guilty or is this a plot to undermine the young Viscount?

Event three in the Viscount Series.

An adventure for characters level 3-8.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
210932.name: For Man Nor Beast
210932.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Blinding snowstorms make strange bedfellows. A group of animal priests and a traveling menagerie would be ready to kill each other... if something wasn't already stalking you all. Did it come with the priests? Did it come for the caged monsters? What sort of creature is this Beasteater, anyway?

An adventure for characters level 1-8.

210933.name: The Dungeon of Doom
210933.description:
Writer Introduction

Yours is a path of destiny, of Legend. You have been chosen by an instrument of fate to perform great deeds. However, before you forge your Legend you must first prove your worth by undertaking the challenge of the Dungeon of Doom. Many have preceded you, few have returned. Do you have the skill, the endurance and the heart to overcome the labyrinth?

The Dungeon of Doom is a Dungeon Crawl for 4-6 adventurers of novice to seasoned skill level. It is intended to be a short scenario suitable for 3-4 sessions of play and as such can be placed in any campaign setting with little or no work required by the Games Master (GM). All that is required to play is the Legend core rulebook. All creature statistics are provided. While this adventure is written specifically for the Legend game system by Mongoose Publishing it can be easily converted to any percentile based game system

210934.name: M-Space
210934.description:
Publisher Blurb

M-Space is a d100-based rules system for science fiction roleplaying. Everything needed to play sci-fi games is included here. With this book, a pencil and some paper, you will be able to create imaginary universes and play characters from a variety of cultures and careers. They can pilot starships, meet strange alien lifeforms and visit fantastic worlds.

The game engine used for all this is Mythras Imperative. If you are familiar with any closely related d100 game, you will feel right at home.

210935.name: 10 Dwarves
210935.description: In 10 Dwarves, the player must pass information efficiently to make the dwarves appear in numerical order so that they can win the feast created by Snow White

210936.description: Mystery, secrets, and betrayal. Legendary’s 12th expansion steps into a universe where superpowers are replaced by gritty stories. This 100 card small box expansion hosts Heroes, Schemes, and Villains in a way never before seen in the Legendary universe. This is Legendary: Noir.
210936.name: Legendary: Noir
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 031 – All About Airecon

210937.name: Dia de los Muertos
210937.description:
Dia De Los Muertos is an easy, fun trick-taking card game for 3-6 players which lasts 10-15 minutes. Beautiful, illustrated original art pieces that are visually stunning and reflect the Mexican Holiday - Dia Los Muertos. Non-linguistic, numeric & symbol based, with rules in English & Spanish!

Basic Game:
The game plays in one trick, with the led card determining whether high or low card leads to the next trick. High card takes all cards (which are marked for positive AND negative points). Cards are labeled with suit, rank (1-20), an High/Low indicator, and the points it is worth at the end of the game.

Advanced Game: The High/Low indicator on the card also determines whether the card is collected at the end of the trick by the highest or lowest card played in the trick. So there are two winners (or losers in the case of a pile of negative cards) in each trick.

Contents:

63 cards
Rule Book

Deluxe Edition includes:
1 Coloring Book
16 DDLM Stickers

210938.name: Hero's Song
videogamehonor: 2016 PAX Curse Award Best Indie Game of the Year Winner
2016 PAX Curse Award Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
2016 PAX Curse Award Most Innovative Game of the Year Winner
210938.description:
Hero's Song is a hardcore action RPG and uses the familiar click-to-move and attack controls of classic action RPGs like Diablo III or Path of Exile. Combat takes a more measured pace, giving you time to react to the intelligent tactics of your enemies and to thoughtfully deploy your wide variety of skills and abilities. True to its hardcore nature, combat in Hero's Song is dangerous and has very real consequences including the chance of permanent death. Friendly fire is always defaulted to "on", so positioning and precision are very important considerations. Death will come quickly if you think this is a simple clickfest.

The crowdfunding campaign for Hero's Song was canceled just one week after launch. Pixelmage will continue to develop the title.

Source: The Developer Website.

210939.name: RIFT: The Starfall Prophecy
videogamehonor: 2016 PAX Curse Award Best in Show Winner
210939.description:
The Starfall Prophecies have come to pass. The harbinger of doom is here.

The Comet of Ahnket hurtles through the skies towards Telara, tearing pieces from the planes it passes through and assimilating them into its ever-growing mass. Marshes, forests, deserts, and volcanic wastes have all merged together beneath the shadow of the colossal Tower of Ahnket, creating a new world of unnatural beauty... and unfathomable danger.

Now the Guardians and Defiant must unite against the sinister intelligence that guides the Comet of Ahnket and stop it from swallowing their world.

Source: The Game Website.

210940.name: Fan-Ball
210940.description:
This is an early baseball card game, remarkably complex and well-accessorized for its time. The box includes a deck of 100 cards, a 12" square green felt mat printed with a baseball field, and 18 ceramic chips (9 ivory and 9 rust-colored).

The deck has 22 Ball cards, 21 Strikes, 10 Fouls, 21 Outs, 4 Double Plays, 1 Triple Play, 4 Pick-offs, 3 Safe on Error, 1 Safe on Bunt, 1 Hit by Pitch, 6 Singles, 3 Doubles, 2 Triples and 1 Home Run. Many of the Ball, Strike and Out cards have contingent results depending on location of any baserunners: safe or out on steals, sacrifices, tag-up on flies, fielders choice, and even a passed ball. And one Ball card has "Game called on account of rain" (only if players have agreed in advance to include this result).

This highly detailed deck creates a deep narrative for each game, even if the play itself is simple, involving luck rather than strategy. The deck is shuffled, and the batting player turns over cards one at a time until a third out. Highest score after nine innings of three outs each wins.

210941.name: CON/fused
210941.description:
From the introduction:

CON/fused is a light-hearted Live-Action Role-Playing (LARP) game that must be played at a large “fandom” convention such as WorldCon, Fastaval, KapCon, or Metatopia. It is intended for 3-4 players. In the game, the players assume the rôles of individuals who are not traditional convention fan attendees.

210942.name: Tropical Fish Shop 2
210942.description:
User Summary

You stock a fish store by playing Match 3, Hidden Object, and other puzzle games.
